nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.accounts

Interface AccountService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccountServiceLocal
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccountServiceImpl, AccountServiceSecurity

    public interface AccountService
extends Service
    Account service: manages accounts and account types related operations and calculations broker commission, credit limits, transaction volumes etc.
    Author:
    luis

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canView(Account account)
      Returns whether the logged user is allowed to view details of the given account

      Returns whether the logged user is allowed to view account information for the given owner

      Returns whether the logged user is allowed to view authorized payments for the given owner

      Returns the account that matches the owner and type

      • getAccount

        Account getAccount(AccountDTO params,
                 Relationship... fetch)

      • getAccounts

        java.util.List<? extends Account> getAccounts(AccountOwner owner,
                                            Relationship... fetch)
        Returns all the accounts of the given owner

      • getAccountsFromTTs

        java.util.Set<? extends Account> getAccountsFromTTs(Member member,
                                                  java.util.Collection<TransferType> allowedTTs,
                                                  TransferType.Direction direction)
        Returns a Set with accounts belonging to the allowedTTs AND to the member
        Parameters:
        member - the members whose accounts are checked on this
        allowedTTs - the transfer types to be checked
        direction - a TransferType.Direction enum.
        • If FROM, only accounts from which the checked transfer types come from are included.
        • If TO, only accounts to which the checked transfer types go are included.
        • If BOTH, both from and to accounts of the transfer types are included.
        Returns:
        a Set with accounts belonging to the member, and containing the transfer types in allowedTTs.

      • getBalance

        java.math.BigDecimal getBalance(AccountDateDTO params)
        Returns the account balance at a given time point. When the date is null, returns the current balance. Note that the date is always inclusive. If you need an exclusive date, use AccountServiceLocal.getExclusiveBalance(AccountDateDTO)

      • getCreditLimit

        java.math.BigDecimal getCreditLimit(AccountDTO params)
        Return the credit limit for a given account

      • getCreditLimits

        CreditLimitDTO getCreditLimits(Member member)
        Retrieves the current credit limit

      • getCurrentAccountStatusVO

        AccountStatusVO getCurrentAccountStatusVO(AccountDTO accountDTO)
        Returns an accountStatusVO for the given account status id.

      • getCurrentStatus

        AccountStatus getCurrentStatus(AccountDTO account)
        Returns the current account status for the given account

      • getDefaultAccount

        MemberAccount getDefaultAccount()
        Returns the default account for the current member, but only if there is a logged member. Throws EntityNotFoundException otherwise, or if the member has no accounts

      • getDefaultAccountFromList

        Account getDefaultAccountFromList(Member member,
                                java.util.List<Account> allowedAccounts)
        gets the default account of the member from a list of allowed accounts. If the default account is not in this list, it gets the first account in the list. If the list is empty, it returns null.

      • getMemberAccountVO

        MemberAccountVO getMemberAccountVO(java.lang.Long memberAccountId)
        Returns a memberAccountVO for the given member account id.

      • getRatedStatus

        AccountStatus getRatedStatus(Account account,
                           java.util.Calendar date)
        gets the AccountStatus with rates included. The normal getStatus methods don't bother getting rates, as it involves several other db tables to be checked, and in 9 out of 10 cases the retrieved status doesn't do anything with them. So use this as an alternative to getCurrentStatus or getStatus in case rates do matter. For the rest, works exactly the same as getStatus.
        Parameters:
        account -
        date - may be null, in which the current date is used.

      • hasAccounts

        boolean hasAccounts(Member member)
        Returns:
        true if the member has associated accounts

      • load

        <T extends Account> T load(java.lang.Long id,
                         Relationship... fetch)
        Loads an account by id

      • membersTransactionsDetailsReport
